Solve the normal equations by tha matrix approach and see whether the solutions agree with the earlier calculation derived in the simple linear models. Solution: Let \(Y=(y_1,\dots,y_n)^\top\), \(\beta=(\beta_0,\dots,\beta_{p-1})^\top\), \(\epsilon=(\epsilon_1,\dots,\epsilon_n)^\top\), and let \(X\) be the \(n\times 2\) matrix \[ X= \left[ \begin{matrix} 1 & x_1\\ 1 & x_2\\ \vdots & \\ 1 & x_n\\ \end{matrix} \right].
